iques included: encouraging expectant mothers to 
monitor their own behaviour (eight trials); providing skilled feedback to the expectant mother on her performance 
(six trials); and helping her to set her own behavioural change goals (five trials) [111]. However, some interventions 
were effective and some were ineffective in limiting EGWG, so as yet no clear patterns have emerged relating to
